in std::unordered_map is dangerous.

=== Testing Concurrent Access Danger ===
Player texture initially at: 0x142e046e0

Results:
  Original player texture pointer: 0x142e046e0
  Current player texture pointer: 0x142e046e0
  Successful accesses: 34615
  Crashes caught: 0


=== Real World Scenario ===
Game started with critical textures:
  UI texture at: 0x1440041b0
  Font texture at: 0x1440041b0

Simulating gameplay with dynamic content...

After level 5:
  UI pointer still at: 0x1440041b0 ‚úì
  Font pointer still at: 0x1440041b0 ‚úì

Final check after all levels:
  UI texture: ‚úì Still valid
  Font texture: ‚úì Still valid


=== Summary ===
The current ResourceManager implementation has a CRITICAL bug:
- Pointers returned by loadTexture() and getTexture() can become invalid
- This happens when std::unordered_map rehashes (unpredictable)
- Game code storing these pointers will crash or corrupt memory
- The fix: Change storage to std::unique_ptr<Texture2D>
